enWisdom: Writing is the interpreter of intention
Writing is the tongue of the hand

Wisdom: افْتَحْ [افْسَحْ‏] بَرْيَةَ قَلَمِكَ وَاسْمُكْ شَحْمَتَهُ وَأَيْمِنْ قِطَّتَكَ يَجُدْ خَطُّكَ
enWisdom: Open the sharpened nib of your pen, thicken its point [so that it does not break easily] and cut the edge on the right side so that your handwriting becomes good

Wisdom: إِذَا كَتَبْتَ كِتَاباً فَأَعِدْ فِيهِ النَّظَرَ قَبْلَ خَتْمِهِ فَإِنَّمَا تَخْتِمُ عَلَى عَقْلِكَ
enWisdom: When you write something then take another look at it before putting a seal on it, for indeed [by putting a seal on it] you are only putting a seal on your intellect [as your intelligence will be gauged by your writing]

Wisdom: رَسُولُ الرَّجُلِ تَرْجُمَانُ عَقْلِهِ وَكِتَابُهُ أَبْلَغُ مِنْ نُطْقِهِ
رَسُولُكَ مِيزَانُ نُبْلِكَ وَقَلَمُكَ أَبْلَغُ مَنْ يَنْطِقُ عَنْكَ

enWisdom: The intellects of the erudite scholars are in the points of their pens

Wisdom: كِتَابُ الرَّجُلِ عُنْوَانُ عَقْلِهِ وَبُرْهَانُ فَضْلِهِ
enWisdom: The writing of a man is the symbol of his intellect and the evidence of his merit

Wisdom: كِتَابُ الْمَرْءِ [الرَّجُلِ‏] مِعْيَارُ فَضْلِهِ وَمِسْبَارُ نُبْلِهِ
enWisdom: The writing of a person is the gauge of his merit and the measure of his nobility
Books are the gardens of scholars
The book is one of the two interlocutors

Wisdom: مَنْ تَسَلَّى بِالْكُتُبِ لَمْ تَفُتْهُ سَلْوَةٌ
enWisdom: Whoever takes solace [and delight] in [reading] books will never lack [any] solace
How good an interlocutor a book is!
